clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Assessment of Patients With High Bone Mass Due to Mutation in Lrp5
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Assessment of Patients With High Bone Mass Due to Mutation in Low Density Lipoprotein l Receptor 5

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to describe patients with a high bone mass phenotype due to a mutation in the low density lipoprotein l receptor 5 gene (LRP5) and compare them with age and sex matched controls. Moreover, bone density and microarchitecture as well as markers of bone metabolism are evaluated

detailed_description.textblock:
Cases and controls are closely matched on age and sex and evaluated cross-sectionally.
Dual x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) and high resolution peripheral quantitative computed tomography (HR-pQCT) are used in order to evaluate bone density as well as microarchitecture. Bone turnover markers and body composition are also measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Bone microarchitecture as assessed by high resolution quantitative computed tomography (HR-pQCT)
primary_outcome.description: HR-pQCT is used to evaluate bone microarchitecture, i.e. bone trabeculae, cortical thickness and trabecular number. Aim is to test if the microarchitecture of these patients are different that observed in normal controls

secondary_outcome.description: Markers of bone resorption and formation are investigated.
DXA is used to evaluate bone mineral density at total hip, spine, whole body and forearm.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with mutation in the Lrp5 gene
arm_group.description: Patients known to have a mutation in Lrp5 known to be causing a high bone mass phenotype

biospec_descr.textblock: Serum, plasma, DNA as well as fat and skin biopsies

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Lrp5 mutation/ADOI
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
